security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown guidance and JSON configuration. No executable code, no file access, no network calls. Safe for publication.

content.user_title: Configure ShellCheck for reliable shell linting
content.value_statement: Shell script issues can hide until production and slow reviews. This skill explains ShellCheck setup, rules, and workflows to catch problems early.
actual_capabilities: Explains ShellCheck installation options and verification
Shows environment variable configuration for ShellCheck
Details common error codes with fixes
Offers CI and pre-commit integration patterns
Describes output formats including GCC and JSON
limitations: Does not run ShellCheck or execute scripts
Does not edit repository files automatically
Does not validate project-specific policies beyond provided guidance
Does not access external resources or APIs

use_cases.title: Add CI shell linting
use_cases.description: Set up ShellCheck in CI pipelines with consistent flags and failure rules.

use_cases.title: Fix common warnings
use_cases.description: Understand key ShellCheck codes and apply safer quoting and flow patterns.

use_cases.title: Standardize lint rules
use_cases.description: Define shared .shellcheckrc settings and documented suppressions.

prompt_templates.title: Get started
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how to install ShellCheck and run it on a single script. Include one example command for Bash.

prompt_templates.title: Project config
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a .shellcheckrc for Bash with a few enabled checks and two disabled codes. Explain each setting.

prompt_templates.title: CI integration
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a minimal GitHub Actions step that runs ShellCheck on all .sh files and fails on warnings.

prompt_templates.title: Suppress warnings
prompt_templates.prompt: Show how to suppress SC1091 and SC2119 in a script and document why the suppressions are safe.

output_examples.input: I need a .shellcheckrc for bash and a CI plan to enforce it.
output: Recommended .shellcheckrc settings for Bash with brief explanations
CI command to scan all .sh files and fail on issues
Notes on safe exclusions and when to revisit them

best_practices: Set the target shell explicitly before linting
Document every suppressed code with a reason
Run ShellCheck in CI and in pre-commit hooks
anti_patterns: Lint bash scripts as sh or dash by default

faq.question: Is this compatible with Bash and POSIX sh?
faq.answer: Yes. It covers Bash and POSIX sh settings and shows how to set the target shell.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance only and does not run ShellCheck or modify your repository.

faq.question: Can it integrate with CI systems?
faq.answer: Yes. It includes examples for GitHub Actions and GitLab CI usage.

faq.question: Does it access my files or credentials?
faq.answer: No. It contains static documentation and does not access your system.

faq.question: What if ShellCheck reports too many warnings?
faq.answer: Use targeted suppressions and set a clear policy for reviewing excluded codes.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic linters?
faq.answer: ShellCheck is specialized for shell scripts and includes shell-specific diagnostics.
